sub_title: Sr. Advisor & Administrator, national pathology & molecular protocols (Synoptic Reporting) at Foundation Palga
summary:
A mediator between neighboring organizations active in the pathology of care. Extensive knowledge in standardized structured reporting (synoptic reporting) in, pathology, national cancer screening programs, information exchange, ICT, finance and quality assurance. Wide interest in the healthcare chain in which pathology is participating.

As senior advisor and administrator I have  a central role in the development and maintenance of more then 35 national pathology protocols (standardized structured reporting or synoptic reporting) within the field of pathology according to Dutch multidisciplinary guidelines, ICCR and national screening programs such as cervical, colon and breast cancer. Furthermore developed a modular  national protocol for moleculair testing for NGS, WGS etc, in collaboration with clinical biologists and pathologists. Next to that integration of artificial intelligence and SNOMED CT coding, for better research and interoperability across different EHR, and for better patient understanding 

In addition, a coordinating role in the development of standardized structured reporting or synoptic reporting information transfer between various national scientific databases / institutes and EHR in hospitals and otherorganisations. . Close collaboration with various disciplines such as surgery, pulmonary medicine, gastrointestinal medicine, dermatology,  Commission Palga Protocols, and expert groups from the Dutch Pathology Society at developing,  mutating and maintaining these national pathology protocols.

Co-author of the national guideline of practice "for quality examination of the uterus cytopathologisch version 2.0, 3.0 and 3.1" and the national multidisciplinary guideline "cervixcytologie" (2016)

Supporting and advising internationale projects on synoptic reporting and organisation on a national or regional level like in Norway, Sweden, France and Germany.

International involvement in SNOMED CT International for Synoptic Reporting and involvement  in the Synoptic Reporting Implementation Committee (SRIC) of the ICCR.

International Advisor ( non profit) on implementation of Synoptic Reporting on a national scale.

projects.title: Development molecular diagnostics within the National Pathology PALGA Protocols
projects.description: The development of a national reporting for molecular diagnostics in synoptic reporting as a stand-alone and integrated within the existing national pathology protocols. For mutation analysis for colon cancer, lung cancer, melanoma, etc. The report is developed along the ESP guidelines and molecular diagnostics guidelines from the CMDP.

projects.title: Themadag "It's all about Synoptic Reporting"
projects.description:
Stichting PALGA is een jaar bezig geweest met een aanbestedingstraject voor nieuwe software ter vervanging van de huidige protcolmodule. Op 13 september jl.  heeft een select gezelschap van pathologen voor het eerst kennis kunnen maken met de nieuwe protocolmodule.
Deze pathologen hebben unaniem een positief advies gegeven aan het Bestuur van Stichting PALGA om met deze nieuwe module door te gaan.
Inmiddels heeft het Bestuur groen licht gegeven voor verdere ontwikkeling en herbouw van de bestaande protocollen. 

Stichting PALGA organiseert daarom op 15 januari 2014 een themadag “It’s all about synoptic reporting” waarin wij alle facetten omtrent deze nieuwe ontwikkelingen met u willen delen.

Onderstaande punten zullen de revue passeren:
•Inleiding en planning voor de komende jaren
•Presentatie van nieuwe samenwerkingspartners LogicNets en van ICT Automatisering
•Demonstraties van live protocollen
•Demonstraties grafische editor
•Aanbod cursussen voor zelfbouw door ICT Automatisering
•Presentatie van MagnaView PATHOS versie 6
•Koppeling DICA (DSCA)
•Integratie met protocollen met andere systemen
•De uitrolplanning nieuw software
•Wetenschappelijk onderzoek gebruik protocollen
•Technische visie PALGA

projects.title: Development Synoptic Reporting National Pathology PALGA Protocols
projects.description:
In januari 2012 we started working on the development and implementation of more than 26 of synoptic  reporting protocols  for oncological pathology specimens. The protocols are made according the multidisciplinary guidelines for oncological healthcare (www.oncoline.nl), following the WHO-tumour classification and using the latest edition of the TNM-classification of malignant tumors.  These automated and structured protocols generate a dataset with a legible microscopy, conclusion and SNOMED code for the national database (www.palga.nl).  In the protocols both mandatory and non-mandatory  questions are used to guide the pathologist through the report. Several questions provide room for free narrative text. 
Before 2012 synpotic reports  for breast cancer and colorectal cancer were already in use. This method of reporting is so succesful that the development of other reports was started. Already implemented are the protocols for reporting colonic biopsies (in the population study for colorectal cancer), endometrial carcinoma, ovarian cancer, melanoma, lungcancer and for cancer of the stomac and esophagus. The synoptic reports for skin cancer,  renal cancer and cancer of the urinary bladder, ureter, prostate, uterine cervix and  thyroid  are in development. Synoptic reports for reporting biopsies of lung, prostate and breast are now in first stage of development. 
The whole program is commissioned by the PALGA foundation (www.palga.nl) and the Ducth Society for Pathology (www.pathology.nl).

projects.title: Development Framework and Implementation Synoptic Reporting National Pathology PALGA Protocols
projects.description:
A beautiful project which is a major step forward in the synoptic reporting within the field of pathology. National pathology protocols in a modern environment. Become a world leader in the field of synoptic reporting for the daily work. In collaboration with ICT Automatisering, LogicNets and DTHS.
The project includes the development and implementation of more than 26 national pathology protocols over a period of 2 years.

contributors.headline: Sr. Advisor & Administrator, national pathology & molecular protocols (Synoptic Reporting) at Foundation Palga
Chief Technology Officer at LogicNets, Inc

profile_positions.description:
Palga manages a national database that encompasses pathology reports since 1971 with national coverage since 1991. All pathology laboratories are connected to this national network and database. The database provides researchers with data. To enhance the quality of reporting, Palga developed synoptic reporting (standardized electronic pathology report forms) for all major tumor types.

- Development of national protocols pathology as synoptic report
- Manage national protocols for pathology & molecular testing 
- Information at national level protocols within Pathos (until 31/12/2019)
- Management software and system protocol within Palga Foundation
- Implementation and training
- Secretary Working Group Protocols, Palga Foundation
- Secretary Working Group Protocols Moleculair diagnostics , Palga Foundation
- Close collaboration with various disciplines such as surgery, pulmonary medicine, gastrointestinal medicine, dermatology for exchange dat from the national synoptic pathology reports.
- Redevelopment protocols for LogicNets
- Close collaboration with IT companies
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor & Administrator, national pathology & molecular protocols (synoptic reporting)

profile_positions.description:
The objective of SRIC is to 
1.	Provide guidance to the Board of Directors on matters relating to the implementation of ICCR cancer datasets, 
2.	To advance the detailed technical aspects impacting the efficient implementation of standardised cancer datasets,
3.	To foster implementation of Structured Pathology Reporting of Cancer.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Structured Reporting Implementation Committee (SRIC)

profile_positions.description: The SNOMED International Cancer Synoptic Reporting Clinical Project Group has been established to review, elaborate, model, deploy and test expanded SNOMED CT content to serve the structured reporting of detailed anatomic pathology (AP) and molecular pathology (MP) data in the diagnosis, staging and treatment of cancer.  The scope of the effort includes all SNOMED International members with interest in standardizing their cancer treatment protocols.
profile_positions.title: Member of the SNOMED International Cancer Synoptic Reporting Clinical Project Group
